Writing exhausted her much more than speaking, yet she relished the work because of what it meant to her Christian experience. "I enjoy the presence of God," she wrote, 


     "and yet my soul is continually drawn out for more of His 
     salvation. . . . Precious subjects I am handling. The last I 
     completed or about completed yesterday,--Jesus healing the impotent 
     man at the pool of Bethesda. It is a great subject, the discourse 
     of Christ, following the healing as He was accused of the Jews of 
     Sabbath breaking."--Letter 1, 1876.
